3210/A0/04/103/002.status_value: The nation-wide data on exclusive breastfeeding is not collected annually ¿ it is only done through the periodic DHS and MICS surveys. In 2012  UNICEF provided technical and financial support to carry out nutrition surveys in 8 States using SMART methodology. IYCF indicators were incorporated in the SMART surveys. The results on the % of children exclusively breastfed are reflected below  - Borno: 12% - Jigawa: 6.3% - Kano: 6.3% - Katsina: 3.7% - Kebbi: 25% - Sokoto: 10.6% - Yobe: 2.7% - Zamfara

The results from the SMART survey on the indicator on complementary feeding (minimum dietary diversity for children 6 ¿ 23 months) is reflected below  -	Borno: 29.4% -	Jigawa: 35.7% -	Kano: 30.1% -	Katsina: 22.4% -	Kebbi: 36.8% -	Sokoto: 16.9% -	Yobe: 15.6% -	Zamfara: 19%
